sen.j: 世襲足媛（よそたらしひめ）は、欠史八代、孝昭天皇の皇后。
sen.e: Yosotarashihime was the Empress of Emperor Kosho, one of the eight emperors who reigned during the Kesshi-Hachidai (Eight Undocumented Sovereigns).
sen.cmt: 欠史八代→定訳不明：Kesshi-Hachidai (Eight Undocumented Sovereigns)
sen.e: Yosotarashihime was the Empress of Emperor Kosho, one of the eight emperors who reigned during the Kesshi-Hachidai (Eight Undocumented Sovereigns).
Yosotarashihime was the Empress of Emperor Kosho, one of the eight emperors who reigned during the Kesshi-Hachidai (Eight Undocumented Sovereigns).

sen.j: 孝安天皇と天足彦国押人命の生母。
sen.e: She was the real mother of Emperor Koan and Amatarashihikokuni oshihito no mikoto.
sen.cmt: 天足彦国押人命→Amatarashihikokuni oshihito no mikotoとしました。
sen.e: She was the real mother of Emperor Koan and Amatarashihikokuni oshihito no mikoto.
She was the real mother of Emperor Koan and Amatarashihikokuni oshihito no mikoto.

sen.j: 『古事記』では尾張連祖奥津余曾の妹である余曾多本毘娘。
sen.e: In "Kojiki" (The Records of Ancient Matters), she is mentioned as Yosotarahime (余曾多本毘娘), who was the smaller sister of Okitsuyoso, the ancestor of the Owari no Muraji.
sen.cmt: 余曾多本毘娘→Yosotarahime (余曾多本毘娘)と漢字表記を加えました。 奥津余曾→Okitsuyosoとしました（統一用語リストではYoso OKITSUとなっています）。 尾張連→Owari no Murajiとしました。
sen.e: In "Kojiki" (The Records of Ancient Matters), she is mentioned as Yosotarahime (余曾多本毘娘), who was a younger sister of Okitsuyoso, an ancestor of the Owari no Muraji.
In "Kojiki" (The Records of Ancient Matters), she is mentioned as Yosotarahime (余曾多本毘娘), who was a younger sister of Okitsuyoso, an ancestor of the Owari no Muraji.

sen.j: 『日本書紀』本文では尾張連祖瀛津世襲の娘である世襲足媛である。
sen.e: According to the main text of "Nihonshoki" (Chronicles of Japan), she is mentioned as Yosotarashihime, who was the daughter of Okitsuyoso, the ancestor of the Owari no Muraji.
According to the main text of "Nihonshoki" (Chronicles of Japan), she is mentioned as Yosotarashihime, who was a daughter of Okitsuyoso, an ancestor of the Owari no Muraji.
According to the main text of "Nihonshoki" (Chronicles of Japan), she is mentioned as Yosotarashihime, who was a daughter of Okitsuyoso, an ancestor of the Owari no Muraji.

sen.j: なお『日本書紀』第1の一書での皇后は、磯城県主葉江の娘である渟名城津媛、第2の一書では、倭國豊秋狭太媛の娘である大井媛。
sen.e: In the 'alternate writing 1-1' of the Nihonshoki, the Empress is mentioned as Nunakihime, who was the daughter of Shiki no Agatanonushi Hae, while in the 'alternate writing 1-2,' she is mentioned as Oihime, who was the daughter of Wakoku Toyoakisadahime.
sen.cmt: 『日本書紀』第1の一書→定訳不明：the 'alternate writing 1-1' transmitted by the Nihonshoki としました。 磯城県主葉江→Shiki no Agatanonushi Hae としました。 第2の一書→定訳不明：the 'alternate writing 1-2' としました。 倭國豊秋狭太媛→Wakoku Toyoakisadahimeとしました。
sen.e: In a first writing in the Nihonshoki, the Empress is mentioned as Nunakihime, who was a daughter of Shiki no Agatanonushi Hae, while in a second writing, she is mentioned as Oihime, who was a daughter of Wakoku Toyoakisadahime.
sen.cmt: 『日本書紀』第1の一書--> a first writing of the Nihonshokiと訳出し（他も同様に訳出し）、冠詞の見直し。
sen.e: The first addendum to the Nihonshoki mentions the Empress is Nunakihime, who was a daughter of Shiki no Agatanonushi Hae, while the second addendum describes her as Oihime, who was a daughter of Wakoku Toyoakisadahime.
sen.cmt: In a first writing in→The first addendum toin a second writing, she is mentioned →the second addendum describe
